thread.title: Hollywood cemetery does Day of the Dead right
thread.title_full: Hollywood cemetery does Day of the Dead right - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Christine Delsol
title: Hollywood cemetery does Day of the Dead right
text: Hollywood Forever Cemetery is not only the eternal home of such movie icons as Rudolph Valentino, Cecil B. DeMille and John Huston, it also claims the state’s biggest Day of the Dead celebration. It also can make a case for being the most authentic, since Mexico traditionally celebrates with departed loved ones at local cemeteries. The grounds host art exhibitions, dancing, music, a local artists’ display of altars, children’s arts and crafts, and a skeleton costume contest. This year’s theme is “Shamanic Visions of the Huichol,” drawn from mythology of the native Mexican culture populating the Sierra Madre Occidental Range.
